author: {'steamid': '76561198196043927', 'num_games_owned': 1548, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1705506063}
review:
一周目はかなり面白かったが、複数回プレイしていると粗が目立つ。
アイテムもスキルツリーもドロップ品もランダムなのは効果がわからないうちは楽しいが
タネが割れてしまえばハズレばかりのガチャを引かされているに等しい。
戦闘バランスも大味で、防御力の概念がない割に敵の攻撃はどんどん痛くなっていく。ｌ
こちらの攻撃力も途中から頭打ちだが敵のHPは増え続ける。
ザコ敵とボスの強さの違いがHPぐらいしかなく、ボスの一番強い行動はザコ敵召喚で間違いない。
お互いの攻撃の当たり判定もよく分からないことが多い。

author: {'steamid': '76561198101064176', 'num_games_owned': 993, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1569146044}
review:
Asura Vengeance Edition is an action-packed hack and slash game developed by Ogre Head Studio and released on PC in 2017. Unfortunately, the game falls short in many areas, making it a disappointing experience for players.

One of the biggest issues with Asura Vengeance Edition is its repetitive gameplay. The game's levels are uninspired and lack variety, with players fighting the same enemies and using the same moves over and over again. This leads to a tedious and boring experience that quickly loses its appeal.

Another problem with the game is its lackluster story. The game's plot is generic and forgettable, with a one-dimensional protagonist and forgettable supporting characters. The game's cutscenes are poorly executed and fail to engage players in any meaningful way.

The game's visuals are also subpar, with low-quality textures and uninspired character designs. The game's sound design is also underwhelming, with forgettable sound effects and an unremarkable soundtrack.

Overall, Asura Vengeance Edition is a lackluster game that fails to deliver on its promises. Its repetitive gameplay, uninspired story, and subpar visuals make it a forgettable experience that's not worth the time or money. If you're looking for a hack and slash game that's engaging and fun, you're better off looking elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321769904', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 3717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3717, 'last_played': 1684439073}
review: 毫无疑问，阿修罗乍一看有点不知所措，因为它感觉就像一个标准的地牢爬行掠夺者，有大量的RPG元素直接扔到你的脸上。像之前的许多伟大的Roguelike一样，只需要几次通关就可以掌握如何驾驭这匹野马。它很酷的设置和平衡的技能树让任何暗黑破坏神挖掘者'roguelike lovin'landlubber 都能跳进去玩得很开心。这里有大量的物品、能力甚至角色可以解锁，为你提供充足的游戏时间。就体面的动作Roguelike而言，这款游戏肯定是一回事。

author: {'steamid': '76561197975846106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 1290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1081, 'last_played': 1671655072}
review: I don't like this game very much and I'll say why. the arenas a much too narrow, the writing on the screen hinders you to shoot the enemies, the weapons are to weak, the damage you receive is much too high. while you escape the enemies, you get stuck on every little peace of the arena and if you shoot, the hero stands still for a second, which can mean the death to you. you are not allowed to do even one mistake. if you do so, armor gets broken and where you had 5 plus health, all of a sudden, the plus 5 health are gone. there is no fun in this game, only pain. if you like pain, get this game. i don't like that much pain. this game is a joke, but sadly a bad one!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198311989017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1670767716}
review:
https://blog.naver.com/jampuri/223048868580 <- 장문의 리뷰는 이쪽.

인도산 로그 라이크 게임.

게임 기본 디자인과 전투 스타일을 보면 디아블로 3 같은 핵 앤 슬래시 게임인 것 같지만 실제로는 로그 라이크로 맵 디자인, 적, 아이템, 오브젝트, 스킬 트리 등이 게임을 할 때마다 매번 바뀌고. 죽으면 무조건 1스테이지부터 다시 시작해야 한다.

던전 탐사보다는, 맵상에 있는 적을 전멸시키고 보스를 때려 잡고 다음으로 넘어가는 스테이지 클리어형이라서 핵 앤 슬래쉬 게임이 되었어야 할 걸 로그 라이크 문법으로 풀어낸 느낌이라, 뭔가 위화감이 드는데 실제로 문제가 적지 않다.

적을 죽이면 경험치, 돈, 드롭 아이템을 전부 얻는 게 아니라. 경험치와 돈/아이템 드랍 중 하나를 선택하는 것부터 시작해, 게임 내 돈 드랍율이 터무니없이 낮아서 돈이 1단위로 들어오는데. 상점에서 파는 아이템은 플레이어의 레벨이 오르면 가격이 올라가 인플레이션이 미쳐 돌아가고. 스킬 쿨다운이 분 단위로 1카운트씩 감소하는 비정상적인 구조 때문에 스킬을 새로 배워도 자주 사용할 수 없는 데다가, 스킬 트리가 랜덤이다 보니 운이 좋으면 초반에 성장하기 좋은 스킬을 얻을 수 있지만. 반대로 운이 나쁘면 그 게임에서 죽을 떄까지 유용한 스킬 하나 얻지 못하니 불합리한 구석이 많다.

재료는 괜찮은데 레시피대로 조리하지 않고, 감으로 조리하다가 본연의 맛을 내지 못한 음식 같다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189372717', 'num_games_owned': 1089, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2006, 'last_played': 1666436863}
review:
6/10动作类的rougelite游戏，工作室是印度的所以整个背景故事看不懂（其实本身也聊胜于无）。
 
虽然是小作坊作品但是手感和玩法都很有趣，但是这个过程是循序渐进的，刚上手这个游戏一定会觉得手感奇怪且难度很高，不熟悉各种武器的抬手以及耐力槽的消耗前真的很劝退，非常容易因为没有耐力而暴毙。更让人难以接受的就是debuff系统，游戏中部分怪攻击会附加燃烧效果，这个效果会永久破坏你的防具，导致人物的build和能力值直线下降甚至回归白板，这也是前期没搞懂玩法的迷茫时期最劝退的（商店有灭火器！）。

如果能坚持熟悉游戏流程后会发现本作许多优点，习惯耐力槽设计后游戏会变得简单，基本战斗模式就是回合制翻滚-摸刀，游戏内武器分为近战-远程-魔法，敌人也分为这三类，同种武器攻击会产生抵抗导致伤害降低，战斗过程是鼓励针对不同敌人切换不同武器，但三个难度的流程玩下来发现平衡性并没有做好，远程武器无限强势只要成型秒天秒地还安全。

本作的build构建也做的很有意思，击杀敌人后可以选择吞噬与掠夺，吞噬可以使人物升级获得技能点，可以选择不同的强化方向，掠夺则会掉落金钱以及随机掉落道具，可以锻造装备购买道具来强化自生。前期很容易钻死胡同只吞噬或者只掠夺，还是要在适当的时候选择不同的奖励方式，推荐前两层只吞噬到1级看看技能树，后面全部掠夺后去商店购买武器伤害的道具以及钥匙，后面看情况吞噬，基本不用升到满级除非技能树天胡。这样能使得你的游戏流程变得容易。

游戏流程从难到简单，整体还是偏简单，熟悉了后很容易上手。游戏画面很单调，音乐更是可以说一团糟，游戏除了技能树系统，其他的随机性都很少，虽然有很多种boss但是打法都大同小异全部都是回合制，道具很少也导致build匮乏强弱差距很大，武器虽然也很多但是好用的不多，多数就是数值的差异。总体来说还算好玩，但是耐玩性和平衡性一般。

review:
Pretty easy to get into and really fun, with a random skill tree every time you play you're gonna get a lot of replayability out of this one.

And if you want a challenge, you unlock higher difficulties after finishing the game in a lower one.

Vengeance Mode is an arena where you fight 3 waves of enemies and then a boss and repeat until you die, you have the option of buying weapons/armor/items in between rounds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085154250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2070, 'last_played': 1647628792}
review:
I recommend this game as I have enjoyed it very much.

I have played Asura: Vengeance in short, intense bursts and finally achieved its true ending (Rise of the Demon King) just today while my 9 year old daughter Ariadne has recently achieved the game's first ending (the Betrayal) on her first go, no pause nor save, after watching me play it. Dark, heroic and masculine; Asura: Vengeance is an action game that demands tenacious focus and adaptability.

I am Ambrax, an old biker.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052969530', 'num_games_owned': 886, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1632182204}
review:
J'vous jure j'ai essayé ! J'ai essayé d'aimer Asura avec son petit mélange de hack'n'slash et d'action roguelike, son univers à lui et ses mécaniques plutôt sympathiques (après avoir tué un ennemi il vous faudra choisir entre le transformer en XP ou le looter par exemple), et puis il a une bonne tête mine de rien...

Seulement voilà, le gameplay est rigide, oh pas rigide et courbaturé comme un nonagénaire par -40°, mais un peu quand-même, la faute à son système d'endurance dont on aurait pu se passer volontier pour les attaques, pour limiter les roulades je veux bien comprendre...mais limiter l'action dans...bah un jeu d'action, c'est dommage...

Et franchement, si j'avais pas joué à Hades avant j'aurais pu l'aimer ce petit roguelike de derrière les fagos, mais nan, pas possible votre honneur, vraiment ...alors bon, si vous n'avez pas joué à Hades...déjà...POURQUOI ?! 
Mais si c'est le cas, vous arriverez peut-être à aimer Asura.

6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198231493012', 'num_games_owned': 1075, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1624923349}
review:
Asura isn't horrible, but it definitely is not good enough.  The player is simply not given enough to do or to care about, and the play is dull and empty whether you're weak or strong, with boring rooms that aren't worth the large amount of time spent walking between them, glaring poor design on both play and interface, and little if anything to offer the player for their time.

For example, instead of sensibly letting you teleport between empty rooms like most of these games have realized is a necessary reduction on squandering player time, this game gives you a single placeable teleport-return point.  Being able to plan to skip one backtrack will quickly and repeatedly remind you how much boring backtracking you are still stuck doing over their dead-end laden chains of empty squares.  One has to wonder why a developer chooses to waste so much player time. Asura leaves one wondering many such things.

The theme is cute in theory, but applied excessively, so it mainly just amounts to [i]everything[/i] having uselessly impenetrable labels.

This is a pass.  Even if you can find good about playing it, you can do better with your time in better designed games, and should reward those games instead.  It doesn't really even make for useful variety.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072103443', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1609202148}
review:
Tl;dr: não joguem Asura tendo Hades como parâmetro, porque vão se desapontar extremamente com esse jogo. 

Apesar de ter conseguido zerar, achei esse jogo bem ruim. Talvez seja culpa minha, pelo meu timing de ter vindo jogar ele após ter tantas horas de jogo em Hades, mas Asura é um jogo extremamente repetitivo e pouco recompensador. 

A árvore de habilidades te dá a impressão de que você tem alguma variedade no gameplay, porém poucas delas são realmente úteis e você acaba sempre selecionando as mesmas e até lamenta quando ela não aparece naquela sessão, pois a árvore é sempre aleatorizada no início do jogo. 

As armas são desinteressantes e não tem uma variedade tão grande quanto parece e eu sempre corri atrás da tática mais pão com manteiga que era pegar uma arma corpo-a-corpo bem rápida, pra não ser surpreendido pelos inimigos, e uma de longa distância que não precisa de munição, tipo uma estrela ninja ou uma magia. 

Os inimigos são desbalanceados e muitas vezes te acertam mesmo estando fora da hitbox dos ataques deles. E por fim, a história é uma piada. 

É triste avaliar negativamente esse jogo, pois tem tanta gente falando bem, mas eu realmente não consegui gostar dele. Fora que achei super mal aproveitada a cultura indiana nesse jogo, porque a história é muito rasa e você só tem acesso a ela naquelas telas de loading entre biomas, que são sempre na mesma sequência, e nas cutscenes do início e do fim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277475050', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 3997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1960, 'playtime_at_review': 1847, 'last_played': 1712403704}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042940073', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1621782700}
review:
以印度神話為題材的 Rogue-like 遊戲，雖然遊戲中對於劇情著墨不多，但在換幕時的故事設定頗為有趣。

- 遊戲採上帝視角，打擊感相當不錯。
- 主要的組合樂趣來自於每局隨機生成的技能盤，武器方面的變化倒是不大。
- 受到傷害時身上裝備會毀損，所以玩到最後幾乎都是用遠距武器或魔法慢慢尻。
- 關卡數不多，但有許多難度可挑戰。

整體而言算是不錯的小品。

author: {'steamid': '76561198010060605', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1614072371}
review:
Wanted to like the game, but it just falls short in a lot of areas. The story and cut scenes are pretty good, but a lot of the mechanics seem pretty bland overall. You can't dodge melee attacks and this game uses a stamina bar for dodges/attacks. Fire will burn you and break a random item. Everything seems to be faster than you, so getting movement speed items is a must.

Great for an indie game I guess, but just not my cup of tea after playing stuff like Rogue Legacy/Hades/Skul. Buy it if its cheap, otherwise you can skip out on this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197330559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1940, 'last_played': 1613992139}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1613399890}
review:
Asura is a low poly 3D top down twin stick shooter/brawler with lightweight RPG elements. 

While some effort went into some aspects of the game, other design choices are bewildering.  PC gamers will be immediately insulted by the suggestion that a console peasant childrens toy gamepad should be used.  Basic testing was not conducted.  Any system using PC gaming controllers like racing wheels, pedals, HOTAS etc has these devices mapped as if they are console peasant toys, making the menus difficult to navigate and making the character run constantly in one direction.  Why was basic testing not done on PC? 

This is quite obviously a console game due to the low poly assets and console peasant control scheme, but doesn't seem to be released on the consoles.  Developers must try to understand which platform they're developing games for.  Mobile games belong on mobile phones, console peasant games belong on console peasant appliances, and PC games belong on the elite gaming platform, the PC.  

The game breaking flaws, easily detected and fixed if they had put in basic testing, plus the console peasant focus (despite not being released on consoles) prevent this from being recommendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198996795179', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2300, 'last_played': 1685559447}
review:
Неплохая игра. Но количество багов просто кошмарное. Хочешь использовать телепорт? - будь готов к тому, что ты встанешь как вкопанный и не сможешь двигаться. Хочешь использовать телепорт и НЕ дропнуть вещь? - Игра:"Я подумаю". Хочешь использовать вещь и одновременно НЕ атаковать? - Игра:"Я подумаю". 
[b]Самый неприятный баг, который мне попался - невидимые, бл*ть, мобы на арене с боссом.[/b]
[b]Самый приятный баг,который мне попался - двойная награда за одного босса.[/b]
Есть еще несколько глюков, но мне лень их перечислять. 
Все они, к счастью, терпимы, и не сильно влияют на геймплей. Тем не менее, их стоило бы убрать из игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049117712', 'num_games_owned': 1229, 'num_reviews': 406, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1610782364}
review: No doubt is Asura a bit overwhelming at first glance, as it feels like a standard dungeon crawling looter with a ton of RPG elements thrown right in your face.  Like many a great roguelike before it, it only takes a couple of playthroughs to get a grasp of how to harness this wild horse.  It's cool setting and well balanced skill tree allow any Diablo diggin' roguelike lovin' landlubber to jump in have a good ole time.  Plenty of items, abilities, and even characters to unlock here, providing plenty of playtime for your buck.  As far as decent action roguelikes go, this game is A-sure-a thing.  (Who doesn't like a bad pun here and there?  Oh, you don't?  My sympathies...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198022265748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1617818572}
review:
Original et un peu déconcertant avec un sacré potentiel.
Les arbres de compétences sont énormes et aléatoires à chaque partie.
Il y a une grosse liberté de choix tactique et stratégique en montant les compétences,forgeant les armures et armes ou en achetant les items...
Un peu trop difficile à mon gout...Faut tout recommencer depuis le début avec rien (ou presque) dés que Asura meurt.
Finir la partie tient du vrai challenge : c'est à la fois décourageant et super énervant et j'y retourne pour essayer la meilleure stratégie.
Une fois la partie gagnée,on peut recommencer avec un Asura différent et on a droit à un mode vengeance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032255243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1582773239}
review:
Really enjoyed the game! There was a good mix of Issac and POE mechanics that just seemed to work well together. 

Pros:
Combat was fun and smooth
Unique items all felt unique
Boss fights were all fun
Each character felt different to play

Cons: 
After playing through a couple times, the content starts to feel repetitive
There is not to much variety with the enemies and level layout as you progress
Equipment breaking was a little frustrating. If I am playing bad and get all of my stuff broken, it becomes even harder to recoop my losses.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065877448', 'num_games_owned': 4151, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1604287741}
review: This game requires completion on Hard to see the full ending. There's a good amount of variety in the items and builds although there is a lot of randomness to the Skills available. Combat is very punishing and satisfying and there is a good variety of enemies and bosses. Playing with MSI Afterburner or RivaTuner on could cause the 64bit executable to fail to boot; there is a 32bit private beta you can find the key for in the discussions. This shouldn't keep you occupied for too long but it should be at least 5-10 hours of good fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030501391', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1604790545}
review:
Very engaging game. Its hard even in Normal difficulty. Surely there are some ways to improve the game. Yes it might get annoying and repetetive at times but its a decent game for its price. Probably one tick lower than Hades - or maybe two? 
But who cares, two indian guys made a good game given their resources, just support them. They will develop one better for sure. 
P.S. Its good to use Indian mythology, but there were too many indian names from weapons to the menu options. After some point you start not caring about any names in the game. But this is probably the only major mistake. (not even that major)

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198035100973', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 766, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1588889076}
review:
Doesn't seem like a bad game, but it just felt inferior to binding of issac in almost every way in terms of gameplay, without really offering any compelling improvements.

Because they went for the 3d presentation they have actual hallways connecting rooms, unlike issac where you simply go from room to room. This almost doubles your travel time when exploring floors because all the hallways are the length of a small room. Also you can see the environment outside the rooms, which again looks nice visually. But with the outside environment and connecting hallways on the screen, this results in a lot of useless screen space in terms of gameplay. Which results in the camera being zoomed out way too far in order to compensate. This isn't really something that can be fixed, it's just a natural side effect of going with this style of 3d presentation.

And then combat wise, the game seemed to be 100% kiting, weather you were melee or ranged. This makes the game feel extremely tedious and slow to clear rooms. You hit the enemy, run around until there is an opening, hit the enemy, repeat. You can't move and attack at the same time, which feel's very clunky in comparison to other games where you can actively move and attack or parry attacks, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065991554', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1582208932}
review:
[h1] やらされ感が強い [/h1]

難易度がいくつかあるが、最初は一番簡単な難易度しか選べず、順番にクリアして行く必要がある。
にも関わらず、最初の難易度でラスボスを倒しても「ワシはまだ死んでないぞー」的な事を言って復活してくる。ようは、全難易度クリアしないとトゥルーエンドには行けないと。

なんでこういう事するのかなー、バカなんじゃないかな。
好きな難易度選んでそれクリアしたら目的達しましたメデタシメデタシでいいじゃない。
いやこれがさ、金貰ってる仕事なら仕方ない次行くかってなるけどさ、逆にこっちが金払ってプレイしてやってるんだからさ。
なんで制作者のエゴに付き合ってやらなきゃならないのよ。

そこらへん、東方シリーズはよく分かってるよな。
最初の頃はイージーだとラスボス前で終わってたけど、後々ちゃんとイージーでもトゥルーエンド見られるようになったもん。
やっぱ同人ゲーム制作者としての格の違いと言うか、年季の違いってもんが出てるよ。
余計なエゴは切り捨てて、ステージは用意しました、後は好きに遊んでくださいと放り投げる度量と言うか、そういうものがこのゲームからは感じられない。
要するに小せぇのよ、器が。

author: {'steamid': '76561198034146309', 'num_games_owned': 2545, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1579721865}
review:
A very nice rogue-like game. The difficulty is very nice laid out, the OST fits the game, each run is neither too short nor too long, the controls are tight, the game design and graphics are well suited for itself, the narrative is interesting and gives you a nice look into the Indian mythology, most achievements are just based on playing the game, the ones that you need to farm you will get them by just going for the harder achievements - unless you are so pro that you can actually stream roll though the difficulties -, the starting classes aren't that different but are nice to build upon.

It should take you about 10 hours to see most of what the game has to offer - including all difficulties and weapons / perks -, and if you like rouge-like games you should take about 15-20 hours out of the entire game.

An easy one to recommend if you enjoy rogue-like, action RPG games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966299106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1578469079}
review:
Indian Diablo: Curry Edition. India gets a bad rap but its actually a cool game. Its a roguelike dungeon crawler in realtime with random level generation. Kind of like Nuclear throne, Enter the Gungeon, Binding of Issac, Wizard of Legend, etc. You have to dodge attacks and time your attacks when the enemies guard is down. You have a dodge roll!

It doesnt have alot of depth though. Ive got 3 hours into it and im pretty sure ive seen most of what this game offers. There are different bosses but they all play pretty similarly. Most of the different weapons have different stats only, not actually a new moveset. There are really only like 3 melee weapons, 3 ranged, and 1 magic weapon in terms of movesets.

I paid $0.34 cents for this game and feel I got my money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970754116', 'num_games_owned': 960, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1578225163}
review: This is a short rogue-like. An average complete playthrough took me about 40 minutes. But this is not a sprawling open-world RPG. It's not about an epic journey where you constantly improve your character. This is a concise game about improving your own skills. When I finished normal I thought, hey, I'm done. But wait, that ending was not the real ending. I think I'll beat hard next. Then I beat hard and thought, now I'm really done. But maybe there's even more cinematics after the next difficulty. And so I went on to beat Asura difficulty which took me quite a while and while I died a lot it was never unfair, but certainly features random difficulty spikes. There is also a lot to unlock and a lot of different strategies to follow. As far as rogue-likes go, this is one of the better ones. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198032282554', 'num_games_owned': 3464, 'num_reviews': 282, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1578202915}
review:
‎Asura, a tale of vengeance so grand,
In this procedurally generated land.
Graphics lack, a pixelated sand,
Gameplay stumbles, like an unforgiving hand.

Repetitive battles, a tiresome strand,
In this roguelike world, enthusiasm's banned.
A promising premise, a promising stand,
Asura falters, a disappointing brand.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272690093', 'num_games_owned': 961, 'num_reviews': 326, 'playtime_forever': 1301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1608397409}
review:
スタミナ管理が重要な見下ろし型ローグライクアクション。

何をするにもスタミナであり、攻撃するにもスタミナ、回避するにもスタミナが必要。

いわゆるダークソウル系でよく見られる戦闘システムだが、ローグライクアクションではあまり馴染みなかったため新鮮で面白かった。


やたらとゲームパッド推奨を推すゲームだが、内容は一般的な見下ろし型アクションのため、慣れている操作方法でプレイされると良いだろう。
マウス＆キーボードやマウス重視、キーボード重視の操作方法も存在するため、操作性は快適だった。

──────────────────────────────────

ローグライクアクションらしくマップ構成もランダムだが、スキルツリーすらランダムなのも特徴的。

スキルツリーはそれぞれ赤（近接攻撃）・緑（遠距離攻撃）・紫（魔法攻撃）・黄（体力）に分かれており、一定レベルごとに取得できるスキルが増える。

このあたりは一般的な成長システムだが、取得できるスキル自体がランダムのため、1回目のプレイで最初に取得できるスキルと2回目のプレイで最初に取得できるスキルが違う。

取得できるスキル自体ランダムというのも以前からあるが、スキルツリーとして可視化し、毎回新しくビルド構成を考える楽しさがあるのは新鮮で良かった。


もちろん強いスキルとあまり使わないスキルに分かれてしまうが、戦闘が楽になるかはスキルより武器に左右されることが多かったため、いざとなればプレイヤースキルで乗り切れるのも面白かった。

特にスタミナは何をするにしても最重要のため、困ったらスタミナに振っておくと損しないだろう。

──────────────────────────────────

新しいキャラや武器のアンロックなどあるものの、プレイヤーキャラ自体が強くなるアンロック要素はほぼゼロ。

ボスの初回撃破でゲームスタート時に選べるチャクラ（パッシブスキルの一つ）と武器が増えるがそれぐらいであり、序盤を終えるとアンロック要素はほぼないと思えたほど。

私の場合このようなアンロック要素が乏しいゲームは長続きしないのだが、本作は戦闘自体が非常に楽しく、気がつくとラスボス撃破までプレイしていた。

スキルツリーがランダムということもあり、毎回かなり新鮮な気持ちでプレイできたのも理由の一つだろう。

──────────────────────────────────

アンロック要素が少ないとのことでプレイを渋っていたゲームだが、そんなのが気にならないほど戦闘が楽しいゲームだった。

スキルツリーをランダムにする発想も目からウロコであり、ここまで毎回新鮮味あふれるプレイになるのかと思えたほど。


難易度ノーマルでは最初からスキルツリーが全て見えているが、難易度ハードでは徐々にしか見えなくなる。

さらにはノーダメージクリアの実績やWAVE制のヴェンジェンスモードまで存在するため、やり込む場合はかなりやり込めろうだろう。

author: {'steamid': '76561198118493782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 251, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1608249292}
review:
Un divertido Roguelike ARPG que te puede tener una buena cantidad de horas enganchado, lo adquirí en oferta navideña por algo así como 3 dolares y cumple con las expectativas por el precio, [b] incluso full price podría ser comprable. [/b]

[h1] PARTICULARIDADES [/h1]

- Al matar enemigos se nos da a elegir entre absorber su alma (XP) o lootearlo, lo cual nos hace tener que decidir sobre si queremos lootear para ver si nos cae un pedazo de carne que nos recupere esos corazones de vida que nos faltan o si somos avariciosos y queremos subir de nivel para seguir llenando la rama de talentos (del cual hablaré más adelante). 
- Equipo en el cual tenemos arma mágica, arma melee y arma de larga distancia.
- Diferentes tipos de armaduras (manos, hombro, pecho) con diferentes tiers y pasivas que realmente definen (aveces para bien y otras... no tanto).  
- Sistema de perks que podremos ir cambiando entre run y run.
-Un inventario en el que tendremos pociones, carcajs, diferentes tipos de abalorios y consumibles que nos vayamos encontrando o nos vayan dropeando los enemigos.

Y aquí es donde entra el punto negativo que encontré y me molesta bastante. 
Se trata sobre su sistema de ramas de talento en el cual tenemos 4 subramas. El problema no son las subramas, ni el sistema en si, el problema es que a medida que hacemos más y más runs vamos desbloqueando nuevas pasivas y llega a un punto en el que literalmente pasas a lvl 2, ves las pasivas que te tocaron y sabes más que perfectamente que esa run es IMPOSIBLE porque las pasivas que te tocaron o skills son completamente basura. 

[b] Si bien no todo lo que brilla es oro me sigue pareciendo más que recomendable a juzgar por su precio, como dije al principio, si lo agarran  en oferta mejor, y sino, está OK. [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198033263587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 7189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6003, 'last_played': 1578720955}
review: Great face paced rogue like. Combat is very tough but totally fair. Your deaths are your fault for the most part, though there is some randomness to the rooms etc that is typical of the genre. Other than score boards and higher difficulty unlocks there is no overall progression system. This could be expanded upon if the devs were smart. People like to to build up accounts. 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197998598944', 'num_games_owned': 2059, 'num_reviews': 1152, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1632309508}
review:
Steam is an absolute wasteland for Roguelikes and isometric action RPGs.  There just isn't enough special going on with Asura to make it worth your money.

Asura falls into a lot of the same traps as many Roguelikes being made today.  There's a focus on adding all of the elements of a good Roguelike, and not focusing on making the combat and core gameplay loop any fun.

I'm not going to play an average-at-best video game just because it's a roguelike.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044841209', 'num_games_owned': 4387, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1576366569}
review:
This isn't a perfect game, but it's plenty of fun. If you want an action room clearing rogue-lite with a unique spin and you like fiddling with builds, you can have a lot of fun with this.

The good:
The graphics are chunky and basic, but the overall aesthetic is excellent. We don't get many games that pull from Indian mythology. There are a whole bunch of fun weapons (both ranged and melee) and stats to upgrade and optimize. If you know what you're doing, you can get pretty OP. My last run I had a boatload of melee damage upgrades (some that relied on me missing health) and a sword that poisoned, but then I could also shoot fireballs. Choices.

The okay:
The combat is serviceable, but I wouldn't say it's the strongest element. There is a lot of running around and hitting. You have a dodge, stamina, etc. There is a light lock-on for ranged attacks which is much appreciated. Overall, I don't think the combat can stand on it's own. Within the context of the game and it's various systems, it does the job. If they every make Asura 2, I hope they can tighten up the combat a bit.

The bad:
It's a bit slow moving through the levels. You can place a portal to quickly jump back, but only one. It's a very mild annoyance. You might hit a locked room and need to buy a key meaning you'll have to make at least one leg of a long-ish trip.

Give it a shot I say. It can be quite a bit of fun wrapping your head around it's various quirks. Master them and you too can one-shot baddies with a giant hammer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021458975', 'num_games_owned': 1329, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1576498028}
review:
雰囲気と世界観が日本人としては目新しく、ゲームとしては無難に面白い感じです。
日本向けのパブリッシャーがDANGEN Entertainmentなので、そこだけ静観要素かと思いましたが、関係を解消されたそうで一安心です。
いつも通りのゲームを、一風変わった世界観で遊びたいならオススメできます。
developer_response:
Hello, 

Thank you for leaving a review and sharing your feedback.

We just wanted to inform you that we are no longer associated with Dangen Entertainment. 

I hope you have a wonderful day and let us know if you face any problems with the game.

- Z

review:
[h1]向日葵游戏评分：8分（1-10）[/h1]
这是一款Roguelike动作游戏，游戏中除了地图和掉落，就连天赋树也是随机生成，加上击杀敌人后玩家只能从掠夺战利品和获取经验中二选一，因此根据当局游戏的天赋树来选择培养方向尤为重要。
战斗方面，游戏中的装备非常丰富，让玩家大呼过瘾，而优秀的打击感和操控，加上略有难度的游戏设定，都让冒险之旅既紧张又刺激。

author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 654, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1591200317}
review:
Not sure that I can recommend this game, even thought there are a lot of things to like about it. Was hopeful that an ARPG with an Indian theme would catch my interest, but the repetitive gameplay and uninteresting enemies was a rain on the parade. This game controls are like Torchlight and Bastion, because you switch back and forth between melee and arrows; however the zoomed-out camera makes all the hundreds of enemy-types look practically identical. The combat consists of shooting arrows at melee-enemies and using melee on arrow-enemies. It's repetitive and tedious.

After the great introductory cut-scene, there is really not much Indian mythology visible in the gameplay. Only examining the enemy codex will show the background for the different enemies, including descriptions of their folklore. But, as I said, the gameplay makes all the enemies look practically the same. They don't have too varied combat, and they lack the charming AI of a Diablo, Torchlight, or Bastion enemy mob. You just grind through each room, hoping for a powerful weapon drop or enough gold to purchase a couple items at the always-identical store.

It is a rogue-lite, so you will be restarting on every death. The bosses are pretty good, although the first few are very easy, while the fourth is challenging. You will be grinding through the first three levels, just trying to equip yourself for the last level. Each time you fail, you restart with a (very) few unlocks, so you can try again with a few, meek improvements. There just was not enough variety for me to enjoy going through the game again, over and over. It just seemed like a chore. And, even though the skills are randomized, it still comes down to selecting combat, ranged, magic, or aux skills. None of these skills made the gameplay feel much different, either.

I played this game on an Ubuntu linux system with an xbox-type controller. I have no complaints about the technical issues, and the gamepad seemed to work fine. The audio and graphics were passable, although not memorable. Overall, this is a fairly decent first game for a freshman developer, but for ten dollars you can get yourself some significantly better ARPG games on steam. This game takes 1,100 MBs of diskspace, and it uses the Unity game engine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097927902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1582655720}
review:
Sin que sea una maravilla a nivel gráfico (Lo cual permite jugarlo al máximo en un PC bastante antiguo) tiene la suficiente dificultad y fluidez como para que enganche y quieras hacer otro "try" a ver si llegas más lejos.
Por otro lado, el que la ambientación sea india, le da un cierto encanto y originalidad.

Lo que no me ha acabado de convencer es la mínima personalización del personaje, que el castellano no esté como idioma y que la historia, pues en fin, digamos que es bastante mejorable.

Si está en oferta, sin dudarlo. Se le pueden meter horas sin ningún problema.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040860015', 'num_games_owned': 1308, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 2196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2102, 'last_played': 1569035292}
review:
[h1]Summary:[/h1]	[i](longer version below)[/i]
An excellent game if you plan on playing it just to get to the boss and grind it a bit more afterwards. Good amount of content and variety for the price. Disappointingly grindy afterwards if you want to get all the achievements.

[table]
    [tr]
        [th]Achievements:[/th]
        [th]Cloud Saving:[/th]
        [th]Trading Cards:[/th]
        [th]Workshop:[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]YES[/td]
        [td]YES[/td]
        [td]YES[/td]
        [td]NO[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

Click [u][url=steamcommunity.com/id/neon_cacti/recommended/] here[/url][/u] to see my other Reviews or follow my [u][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33254425/]Curator Page[/url][/u] for more recommendations.


[h1]In-Depth:[/h1]
Asura is a quite entertaining and quick roguelike, with smooth controls and a pretty clean UI. I enjoyed the voice acting though it sounded very noisy when Asura talks, as if it had a lot of white-noise.

There are two control schemes for those playing without a controller and you can modify the keybindings. Keys/commands can overlap, for example if F is your bind for the portal and destroying items in the inventory, both might trigger. The game has a decent length and a good amount of collectibles. What annoyed me however is that you must equip items in order to destroy them (cannot destroy them off the ground), and they all award you 1 gold when you dismantle them.

An item called Doodh does not work while poisoned, despite claiming it should negate poison. The burning to death animation is tediously slow, making runs annoying if you use it. Shield skills replenish only after the shield itself broke. Speaking of skills, they're randomised and you'll mostly be using them for difficult rooms due to long cooldowns that decrease by killing enemies. For this reason I stick to passives that enhance attacks.

The worst segment by far, and the one I struggled with was the 100% shastras and items. Due to the RNG it is incredibly grindy and I've reset my character for several hours and still failed to get the final shastra. This part made me forget all the charm this game had.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115047520', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 998, 'last_played': 1589586753}
review:
So, I got this game on a bundle with 12 other games which I paid like $1 for, and I only bought the bundle because I wanted another game in it, so bear in mind I got this game virtually for free. That being said, I ended up playing Asura more than the other game, which I found a little boring to actually play. So, I'll do this in topics to make it an easy read.

PERSPECTIVE
Reminds me of games like Grim Dawn and Van Helsing, your basic top down ARPG camera. You can rotate the camera to come from any direction you want and you can adjust zoom, but the angle between the camera and the ground is sort of fixed.

CONTROLS
Requires heavy use of keyboard and mouse, or light keyboard and a mouse with many buttons. I used all 16 buttons in my mouse and there are still a few keybinds I can only access via keyboard. However the mechanics are pretty straightforward and I found that the game really doesn't have any non-trivial strategies, at least not physically speaking.

GAMEPLAY
Playing this game is a blast. You feel invincible, but also very threatened by enemies, from start to finish. I especially like two main things about this: Random weapons and random abilities. Random weapons are pretty common across games in this genre, so that's that. However, this game innovates by bringing a random ability tree every time you play. There are over 50 different abilities coded in the game, of which you only get access to 12 each run, 4 of each type, each of which follows the traits of one of the "classes" you can select. Despite being basically tougher versions of earlier mobs, late-game mobs always get some slightly new mechanic, and that keeps each level novel enough to be interesting, but familiar enough to get a sense of how you should go about beating it. 

The one thing I don't like about the game is that even if you complete all the levels, there isn't a way to play with the same character a second time(Or at least I haven't found one), so eventually it feels pointless to build characters. To me the game lasted around 15 hours before becoming sort of tedious, but considering what I paid for it, I'd say that's really, really cost-effective entertainment.

There is another mode, sort of an arena mode, but I didn't really enjoy it so I didn't really play it. Could be your thing tho, so if you're still undecided, maybe give it a shot?

author: {'steamid': '76561198050330353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2388, 'last_played': 1561321129}
review:
Rouge-like features and procedurally generated skills for each playthrough increases the replay value of Asura: Vengeance Expansion. Such characteristics of this game may appeal to those who find classic Hack&Slash mechanics monotonous.

Hack&Slash part of this game is still satisfying though, but keep in mind that the variety of loot is somewhat limited. 

At higher difficulties you need to plan carefully on your next move. As such, the skills and items you pick (note that the inventory slot and the available skills are limited), the key you buy/consume to open a locked door, armors and weapons you equip dramatically changes the gameplay and hence the experience.

I highly recommend Asura. Worth every cent!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993383565', 'num_games_owned': 2905, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 942, 'last_played': 1561787996}
review:
Asura: Vengeance Expansion is a slightly different take on the traditional Rogue-lite hack and slash genre. Instead of the typical fantasy tropes you are used to, the Ogre Head Studio team delivers a mechanically sound arena brawler beneath a cloak of old Indian mythos for a unique twist on the recipe. Asura puts the player in a new and interesting role; a human sacrificed to the gods to quell the fears of holy men and their religious prophecies. 

After your rebirth by fire you take the form of a creature of anger and rage determined to bring vengeance upon those who have wronged you. Thematically this is a beautiful piece of leading narrative that fits well within the context of the game. You are reborn, inhabited by the spirit Asura; essentially an unkillable demigod who may fall in battle, but always rises again like some kind of dark phoenix to exact his revenge, punish his enemies, and claim the realm of those who wrought him. I've got to give the creative director credit here, I love when background lore can explain the occurrence of life, death, and rebirth within a game, this simple merging of storytelling with gameplay structure really brings everything together.

As another entry into the Rogue-lite genre you can expect permadeath, randomized level layouts, and limited resources in terms of equipment, money, and experience. Rooms are composed of challenges, traps, loot, shops, forges, shrines, gambling, locked doors, and ultimately the boss. Combat feels solid with impactful sound effects and both melee and ranged weapons which leverage stamina or ammo as a resource, often forcing hit and run tactics as you engage the enemy. Additionally a dodge roll and run option give you the ability to evade attacks at the cost of stamina, balancing the need for offense and defense.

With regard to equipment you have a small 6-slot shared passive / consumable item inventory, 1 ranged and 1 melee weapon, 3 slots for specific armor, and finally a starting buff in the form of a Chakra. Levelling up may provide you with nice passive bonuses or active skills that recharge based on the kills you make. Skills range from providing a shield that protects you from a hit, magical traps you can place in battle, an energy blast that will heal you upon killing its target, to  other various magical buffing abilities and utilities.

This loot/level system may be a point of contention for some, but upon defeating a room you have about 30 seconds to go around and either harvest the souls of the fallen to grow in power, or scavenge their bodies for gold, equipment, and healing items. This choice goes a long way into making each run feel unique as you may make different choices based on your current circumstances and needs. My only real complaint here is that how much experience and or what types of loot you get from enemies feels pretty random. Even if there is a method to this mechanic, actually identifying what enemy you're harvesting on the ground, or remembering how much experience they're worth has not been a skill I've acquired in my ~15 hours playing.

One of my favorite mechanics in Asura is that upon each reincarnation you are given a different random selection of Shastras, essentially powers and passives you can level into instead of the traditional static class-based skill trees. I found this to be a refreshing take on the formula as it prevents you from finding a single perfect build and never deviating from it. Instead this randomly chosen mixture of abilities can appear at any place within its specific branch or doctrine on the skill wheel. Moreover each core ability also provide a stat increase in the form of extra damage, health, or stamina. The caveat here is that for those who want to run specific builds every time, thats not really an option.

Asura has 4 difficulties plus an arena mode which plays differently to the main game. The normal and hard difficulties present good challenges as you get started with the game without being overbearing. Hard and above limits your ability to see the entire skill tree which means you need to level up in order to reveal and unlock various talents. I prefer this to being able to see and pick any talent on the tree as it lends itself to more dynamic gameplay, but its great to see the other option there too on lower difficulty levels. The arena is a single room endurance fight in which you scavenge the fallen to level up or gain gold and consumables. You may use this gold to purchase items and unlock new tiers of upgrades from the arena quartermaster to see how long you can survive.

I would recommend Asura: Vengeance Expansion to anyone who enjoys skill based action focused Rogue-lites. Its got a few rough edges with the UI, keybinds, and a minor bug or two here and there, but on the whole its an excellent game that has enough challenge and variety for most who would enjoy such titles. The uniqueness of its theme combined with a simple but generally enjoyable combat system makes Asura a worthwhile addition to your library, even if theres still a little bit of room for improvement.

-

[H1]Pros:[/H1]
- Combat feels strong and impactful. Attacks stun and push enemies. Stamina management between attack and dodge feels excellent. WASD keyboard movement is very responsive.
- Unlockable 'legacy' progress. 3 additional character variants, a large amount of equipment, skills, and starting upgrades.
- 4 difficulty levels that impart some interesting changes to difficulty and alter how the randomized skill tree is revealed, plus Arena survival mode which plays a bit different to the main game.
- Voice acting: I cant understand a single thing being said without the subtitles, however it sounds great. The character has memorable barks for things such as levelling up and running out of stamina.

[H1]Neutral:[/H1]
- Level design leaves a bit to be desired, the square room architecture does not stand out as being especially engaging.
- Item and weapon design feels a bit samey or 'plus one' in places. More could have been done here, but it gets the job done pretty well.
- Skills / ability design feels just slightly off, some are not as impactful as you'd expect, and some are often must-takes depending on your skill level. Its good, but could be slightly better.

[H1]Cons:[/H1]
- Some actions are hard coded to keyboard controls, are not context sensitive, and cannot be rebound. This leads to some weird issues such as pressing F to drop something and your portal coming out even when you're in your inventory, or right clicking something and your weapon switching in addition to dropping. Pressing X to scrap an item also activates whatever hotkey that is assigned to regardless of mouse / inventory context.
- There are no rebinds for active skills assigned to the number keys 3, 4, and 5, Scrap Item, or Drop Item. I have resorted to using an external key rebinder to remap the active skills to my middle mouse button, left control, and others as it can be difficult to find the right numerical hotkey in battle without taking your hand off movement keys.
- Mouse buttons are barely rebindable, only able to be bound to Attack or Swap weapon. There are other functions in the game such as Roll, Map, Healing, or active skills which might be nice to put on the mouse.
- Inventory management: You cannot click and drag items to sort them in your 6-slot inventory, and there are no slot-specific hotkeys for this inventory. You also cannot sacrifice / deconstruct items from the ground, meaning that if you no longer want a piece of gear because you found a better one, you need to equip the one you dont want, scrap it, then re-equip. This is mildly tedious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035320288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1123, 'last_played': 1591891468}

わりとスパスパ敵を倒せる点

author: {'steamid': '76561198021422660', 'num_games_owned': 3620, 'num_reviews': 1228, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1561050217}
review:
[h1] И это по сути ролевой экшен без особых красот в игре, но с красиво нарисованными заставками [/h1]

И сюжет начинается со сжигания ребёнка из племени, который потом перерождается в исчадие ада и гробовым голосом говорит о мести!!! Трепещи мир обидчиков. Познай месть преисподней!!! Ииии.... Я проиграл первому же боссу. Осечка вышла.

А в остальном я догадываюсь, что нужно было конечно перекатываться, вовремя бить. Но это же ДЕМОН!!! Почему он должен перекатываться от людей??? Почему люди выглядят крупнее демона. Они явно не смотрели Хеллбоя...

В общем, ещё и ввиду отсутствия русского перевода решил также отбросить прохождение в долгий ящик. Слишком большной диссонанс между мрачными заставками и никчёмным персонажем в плане боя...

Зато на линуксе играет нормально даже с контроллером. Есть карточки, облако и достижения. Но русский добавить им лень...

author: {'steamid': '76561198185995181', 'num_games_owned': 1349, 'num_reviews': 900, 'playtime_forever': 1123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1589070206}
review:
操作性远比其他的要素重要，装备再好，等级再高，手残也通不了几关；
被动技能比主动技能重要的多（护盾除外）；
精力比生命重要，请着重注意一切加精力的技能和物品；
如果想要通关，请使用远程装备，例如弓箭，飞镖，魔法球（请搭配加精力的技能和物品），不推荐标枪，命中太差；
最后。印第语配音真给力！尤其是阿修罗的配音，赞！

author: {'steamid': '76561198043385216', 'num_games_owned': 1690, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1559214184}
review:
Por el precio que tiene es un gran juego, si te gustan los hack and slash yo lo compraría sin duda. El juego va muy fluido, los controles responden bien (con mando) y la temática es original. Además tienes muchas opciones para crear y desarrollar tu personaje.

Si se le puede poner algún pero es que los escenarios son muy parecidos entre si y no está en español.

author: {'steamid': '76561198228190400', 'num_games_owned': 846, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1559152604}
review:
A very plesant surprise, and that said from someone that doesn't play many twin stick shooters, and doesn't like roguelike progression in games.
Asura has both of the above, but managed to deliver them to me in a smooth, pleasant and clean way. The gameplay is simple but fast, clean (very nice readability of the scene thanks to clean visuals and good palettes) and brutal.
The lore is just enough that it provides a right amount of flair, and everything in the game works well.
Sure, i find roguelike progression quite frustrating, but that's me, and somehow Asura had me coming back for more despite that much more than most of the roguelike games ever did.
Clean UI do complete the thing. Sure, the genre remains not one of my favorite ones, but this game is spot on.
Gets a 75/100 from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999282226', 'num_games_owned': 972, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1515568143}
review:
Asura is an isometric roguelike whose core mechanic is a randomly generated skill tree. It has all the other trappings of an isometric ARPG roguelike - classes to choose, loot to find, random levels, random enemies, stuff to unlock between runs, and so on, but the core mechanic is the skill tree, so we'll discuss that the most.

The story is decent, and incorporates what I understand is a great deal of Indian mythology. I'm not much of an expert there so unfortunately a lot of the more complicated terms and references probably went over my head. A lot of the skill names definitely did. The aesthetic of the game is bright and colorful, and the areas you go to are varied and interesting to look at, and full of cover, treasure, and traps. Music is alright, nothing to write home about.

Gameplay loop is easy to pick up and understand: Run around with a melee weapon (which can be 1 hand, 2 hand, or dual weild, which uses stamina on swings) and a ranged weapon (which can be ammo based like a bow, stamina based like javelins, or heavy-stamina based like spells, which have unlimited ammo but are very expensive to use stamina wise.) Hit enemies, and either Scavenge them for items and gold, or Absorb their souls for XP. Dodge attacks, don't get hit, damage is hefty and healing can be slim. Generally, you want to Scavenge early for items, and to shop while stores are cheap, then Absorb later when enemies give tons more XP. Enemies are resistant or vulnerable to various attack types, encouraging you to swap around, but due to the nature of the game, and indeed the genre itself, ranged weapons like bows are extremely powerful and dominate the game, speed and damage wise, when properly geared. Spells felt very weak, due to a lack of synergy and increasingly expensive stamina costs. Melee weapons always felt useful, but are inherently more dangerous. At the end of each level is a boss, you beat him and move on, and get loot. Beating a run unlocks new bosses, items, and enemies based on your achievements, and on your very first and second wins, the story of the game. It can also unlock the rest of the 4 character classes you can choose from - Offense focus, Range focus, Defense focus, Spell focus, as well as permanent perks for them to start with.

Leveling up allows you to go into the skill tree, where skills are arranged according to the 4 classes above: Melee dmg (Red), ranged/utility (Green), defense/stamina (Yellow), and magic/spells (Purple). Leveling more of a particular color gives stat boosts to the stats that color governs, such as melee damage for red, ranged damage for green, stamina and defense for yellow and burn/shock/freeze damage for purple. The skills you get by leveling up generally reflect these as well, and come in active and passive varieties. Lower game difficulties allow you to see the entire skill tree from the start. Higher difficulties slowly restrict your view of the skill trees until you can only see skills once you pick them. (It still affects other things like enemy damage, HP, and so on.) This makes your character leveling different every game, even if you want to predominantly play as a melee, or ranged, or etc character. It's an interesting twist, although some of the game's skills are clearly  better than others, forcing you to either not level up that color, or waste points on a skill that's not useful, to get to the really good ones.

Overall, the game is enjoyable, and I got my money's worth. Ranged approaches definitely eclipse other playstyles, but I had success beating runs at the highest difficulty with all weapon types - bows were just absolutely the strongest by far. I would recommend the game to people who enjoy smaller roguelikes - there's not a TON of content, it's not going to be anyone's life-game like nethack, but it's enjoyable, action-y, and has enough variety to keep runs feeling fresh for awhile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109143060', 'num_games_owned': 2209, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1558642328}
review:
On sale for ~5 bucks that was a real good buy - It's no classic but it creates the "just another run" effect and has some cool ideas:

*The background lore is strange but at least new (not the millionth fantasy game). 

*The skill tree changes with each run, which is a cool idea as you can't build a standard strategy that you reiterate over and over.

*You have to decide if you loot your enemies OR get the experience points - This brings in another level of tactics (I need a healing potion which I may afford than, but will I be underleveled?)

So I guess if one doesn't expect too much, this is a nice pastime good for a few hours of fun - I would surely love to see some of the ideas used in a bigger budget game, However this ARPG roguelite, which looks like a mobile port, can live on its own merits...

author: {'steamid': '76561198090287532', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1558307205}
review:
So this is another rogue-like dungeon crawler. This game has the unique aspect where the skill tree is random every time you play it. I was hoping this would make things exciting and truly make every game feel different. Unfortunately…. It really doesn't. 

This is because the skills really aren't a core part of your gameplay, since the cooldown is only reduced by killing enemies, and the cooldown of most abilities is like 7-10…… so you will only be able to use them every 3rd room or so. For bosses, you will only be able to use them once, so it's really not a good idea to rely on your abilities (they're not all that interesting anyways. Some abilities are shields, some abilities let you passively do burn/poison damage, some abilities do a lot of physical/magical damage to enemies, etc… Pretty standard stuff)

Instead, most of your time will be spent running around in a circle sniping enemies. See, you're given a melee and a ranged weapon. The developers tried to encourage you to use both by having ranged weapons do more damage to melee enemies and melee weapons to more damage and stun ranged enemies. Unfortunately, this wasn't enough, and it's correct to use your ranged weapon in like 95% of situations (the other 5% are 1 type of enemy who have shields that deflect ranged weapons and can only be destroyed by melee attacks. Far more enemies needed to have something like this to encourage melee combat).

While this would be fine if enemies posed a challenge, they really don't.  I was thinking that because this game had a "dodge" button, the enemies' attacks would be designed in such a way that you HAVE to dodge in order to avoid damage (e.g. like Enter the Gungeon). NOPE. You can just stay at range and run around in circles shooting at the enemy until they're dead. Hell this works on ALL bosses I encountered, including the final boss.

Because "running around in circles shooting at enemies" is the easiest way to beat the game, your core strategy is also going to be the same in all runs. "Scavenge" enemies for money for the 1st-3rd dungeons. Buy the item that gives you +10 ranged weapon damage and +75% movement speed in the shop. The shop always has the same items and they increase in price as you go up in levels, which is why it's best to buy the items as fast as possible. In addition, enemies drops from "scavenging" only increase by like 50-100% as you reach the final level but the drops from "absorbing" enemies go up by around 400%, so it's better to scavenge early and absorb later.

Finally, there are a bunch of annoying design decisions made throughout the game:
	• There's a "burn" effect that DESTROYS A PIECE OF YOUR EQUIPMENT……. Omg. Why have this….. Just…… why. It's not THAT bad if you carry around a salve that can heal your burns that you can buy from the shop. This item can be used 3 times. However, if you ever run out in a floor and you lose a piece of valuable equipment due to burn, that is absolutely rage-inducing.
	• You can only carry around 6 "passive and consumable" items at a time……God dammit -_- . Guess what, consumables are usually more important than passive stat boosts, since consumables can restore health, prevent burn damage, and refill ammo. Every run, and multiple times within those runs, I had to leave a valuable passive item, which contributed to all the runs feeling samey.

So this is a rogue-like dungeon crawler where you're going to be using the same core strategy and weapon for all your runs and you're disincentivized from carrying around multiple passive items. And each run takes like 1 hour to finish……  I finished 2 runs (both 1st try). There are 4 difficulties that unlock as you beat the previous one. I was going to beat all the difficulties but I died on my 3rd run because I got really cocky and forgot to use 3 FULL HEALTH potions in my inventory (lol). I was thinking of trying again….. But it just wouldn't be very fun so fuck it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975814218', 'num_games_owned': 709, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1550820638}
review:
What a good game.

Great combat, fun procedural skill trees (so tired of games where you find the best option and repeat it), good weapon/armor diversity. It's fun making builds like Diablo but the combat is actually good and thoughtful more like Dark Souls (and not Diablo). The roguelite portion is excellent - you unlock more things for your runs but it's more customization than straight power. Each run is less than an hour and feels very fair when you die.

Only downside is that this game isn't super popular as I'm sure I'm going to want even more content down the road.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319369885', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1612183464}

author: {'steamid': '76561198798477120', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1383, 'last_played': 1606773412}
review:
Asura: Vengeance Expansion

Hikayeye bakış;
Oyunun hikayesinde Hint kralı'nın yağmaladığı topraklarda herkesi kılıçtan geçirerek güç sahibi olur ve tüm topraklarda egemenliğini getirterek Tanrı kral olur. Asura ise yağma zamanı kralın askerlerinden saklanır fakat başarılı olamaz kral onu bulur ve esir alır. Esir alınan asura paganlar tarafından tanrıya kurban edilerek yakılır ve kral tekrardan onurlandırılır. Yakılarak öldürülen Asura'nın ruhu göğe yükselir ve Şeytani tanrılar tarafından Chakrak'a evrilerek gerçek bir şeytan bedenine sahip olur ve tekrar dünya'ya yollanır. Tekrardan dünya'da şeytan olarak doğan Asura kendisi, ailesi ve halkının ölümleri için hemde Tanrı kraldan intikam almak için silahlarını kuşanır. 

Oynanış stili;

Oyun hem konsolda hem klavyede oynanabiliyor. Farklı türk oynanış seçimleri mevcut olması oyuncu tarzı için kolaylık sağlamış.
Mouse+Klavye
Sadece Klavye
Sadece Mouse
Konsol

Oyun için ses sistemi;

Çok harika müzikleri ve seslendirmeleri var. Özellikle Asura'nın sesi, hikayeyi anlatan arkaplan sesi, düşmanların ve kralların sesleri oldukça sert, sağlam ve gerçekci. Seslendirmeler ayrıca Hint mitolojisi eski diline göre yapılmış İngilizce yok fakat altyazı mevcut.

Genel inceleme;
 
İzometrik bir bakış açısına sahip hack N Slash oyunda ölerek ilerliyorsunuz gelişmeler kısa ve zor sürüyor ve her yeni özellik açıldığında daha çok oynayası geliyor insanın ve oyun kendine bağlamayı çok iyi biliyor.

Modlar;

Oyunun kendi intikam modu var ve harika bir şey. ayrıca modül indirebiliyorsunuz.

Son Olarak;

Grafikler:  10/10 Göz yormayan cazibeli ve renkli grafikler.

Aksiyon: 10/10 Hikayesi ve ilerleyişi tamamen aksiyondan ibaret.

Hikaye: 10/10 Çok iyi ilerleyen özel anlatımlı bir hikayeye sahip.

Oynanabilirlik: 10/10 Basit sistem.

Performans: 10/10 Bilgisayar sistemini yormayan ve akıcı bir performansa sahip.

Sonuç: Parasının hakkını sonuna kadar veren bir oyun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198836645763', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1623540382}
review:
This game should be at the top of your wish list, If you like rogue-likes and enjoy hack n slash games, that is. If it is your cup of tea and your like me who prolly searches for games more than actually playing, stop wasting your time and buy this little gem. It’s a pretty straight forward hack n slash dungeon crawler with a lot of bada** loot but the procedurally generated skill tree is what makes it so fun and original. I just bought it and played for 86 min straight. 

GG Devs

author: {'steamid': '76561198248525460', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1544086260}
review:
rogue like元素游戏，甚至技能树每局都不一样（虽然有些简陋就是了）
2D、ARPG类型，而且巧妙地将近战和远程结合，玩起来非常爽
上手也很快，要素不复杂，理解起来也很简单
（稍稍不爽的是这个设定：敌人带火的攻击能烧掉你的装备，好心疼自己的神装被烧掉，看脸刷出来的神装谁曾想就因为挨了一下就没了。。）

难度地话比较硬核，手残党谨慎，全程打下来要求基本上无伤。打法有点回合制的味道，基本上是摸一下怪就滚开的循环，或者远距离biubiubiu
对于近战非常不友好，而远程又要考虑耐力攻击后摇（魔法），箭矢数量（远程）

最简单的模式花了1h解决，依靠远程解决问题，但是到了高难度，敌人比较硬，用近战非常吃力，打的很痛苦就放弃了
无限模式打完大帝(15波)就没打了，后面输出机会太少，敌人攻击力高，血厚，加上装备被烧的七零八落的了，劝退了

author: {'steamid': '76561198260013620', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 2875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2812, 'last_played': 1589197489}
review: I love this game , although its not very popular game its one of the best roguelikes i played this year..I think they balanced the game great cause normal is still challenging for new players and the next difficulty levels become extremely more difficult but you can still beat them if you play the game right! I needed something like 40 hours to finish all the difficulty levels with all the characters , There is a strange skill tree that kinda ruins the game cause sometimes (very often) it gives you abilities that you need later in the game and it doesnt give you abilities that you need early in the game and i believe this is the main factor that this game never became overpopular.. There is a big variety of enemies with their own patterns to learn and its graphic style ingame and its music are nice and fit great to the game.. The artwork in the cutscenes seems kinda cheap but most of this type of games dont even have cutscenes and voiceovers..The story is nice and it makes you like the character more!I hope i see in the future an expantion or an Asura 2! GG had great fun with it !

author: {'steamid': '76561198363600944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5970, 'last_played': 1583705217}
review:
复仇模式无敌方法：（本人复仇模式已经排名第一1113层，已经无敌，自己找死要个排名）
1.选择查来客·罗刹
2.一进复仇模式立刻按2看技能
3.必须刷出红色尤塔圣典技能：纳许拉克桑（核心技能1摧毁目前近战武器获得4点武器伤害）
4.必须刷出绿色查莱克圣典技能：苏拉克夏（掠夺远程敌人获得箭矢）
5.必须刷出绿色查莱克圣典技能：哈达藩（使用技能将会获得索那）
前100层尽量保存实力，小心应对，多用技能积累索那，武器一定要用弓箭，前期拿到巴利达努西就够了。搭配增加移动速度的近战武器和增加速度的护腿。
大概50层以后就可以利用一个BUG，保存并退出游戏，必须完全关闭游戏，再重新进入，这样所有敌人将被重置到大概50层左右的实力，具体多少不清楚。不然敌方将无限叠加攻防等能力，3排满血一击秒杀不在话下。
100层以后利用另一个BUG，保存并退出游戏2次，将会刷新武器库，这样被摧毁的武器再次出现，再次叠加攻击力，到200层的时候配合第一个BUG，你会发现BOSS也就1下秒杀的份。
这样每过30层退出重进一次，不是无敌是什么。

author: {'steamid': '76561197969950224', 'num_games_owned': 930, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1572593986}
review:
TL;DR:  Dead Cells + Binding of Isaac + Diablo/Torchlight = Asura; 9/10, do recommend!

Asura: Vengeance Expansion is a hack and slash ARPG dungeon crawler roguelike with solid combat mechanics, an interesting take on skills, randomized dungeons, varied weapons, abilities, enemies, and bosses, and a lot of replayability.

You are an Asura, a malevolent demigod seeking vengeance against the so-called good guys. This naturally involves killing literally everything in your path on your quest to slay the Maharaja that tried to sacrifice you to the gods

As you play, you unlock new skills to start or level up with, as well as new items and enemies to populate the dungeons with. Not only does this add to replayability, but it feels like you've at least accomplished something even after you die and have to restart. There's also a handy index for viewing everything you've unlocked.

Here are the highlghts:

- The art, music, and sound design are good and fit the setting well.

- The game is set in an interesting world based on Hindu mythology. This can create confusion early on, as things will be referred to with words that many players will probably not be familiar with. Still, it's a good opportunity to learn, and I found it a refreshing change compared to the influences of most other games.

- The combat mechanics are great, with tight, responsive controls. Aiming accurately with ranged attacks can be a challenge during the more hectic fights, however.

- There are four playable characters: the red Asura (melee tree-focused) is unlocked by default; then there's the green Asura that focuses on the ranged skill tree, the purple Asura that focuses on the magic tree, and the yellow Asura that weilds heavy hammers and focuses on the tank tree.

- The procedurally generated randomized skill tree is a nice mechanic that adds a lot to replayability, though occasionally the skills it generates are unhelpful (like having a "boosts all shields" skill available before any shield skills are available to unlock).

- The levels are also procedurally generated. They're not linear, but they're still pretty straightforward. You also have a portal ability unlocked by default (unlimited uses; press the button to set the waypoint, then press it again to jump back to it), which really helps with backtracking. I wish more games with backtracking had a similar mechanic.

I recommend Asura for people looking for a well-designed, satisfying roguelike dungeon crawler with solid combat and lots of replayability. I also highly recommend you play with a controller, which is very obviously how it's meant to be played. I bought the game on sale but I think it's more than worth the full price, a measly $10. Overall I give Asura: Vengeance Expansion a 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043198608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1532001384}
review:
Best Power Rangers game out there. No, seriously: you can play as a Red Dude, Green Dude, Yellow and Purple Dudes :D
Jokes aside: the game is good. It will be suitable for those who like punishing action and completion. 
And the completion here is somewhat special. Yes, you can complete the game (on 1 difficulty) in about an hour or so, but that's not the aim. The real aim of a completion here is to unlock every weapon, rune, ability and kill every single enemy and boss to fill the "encyclopedia". Killing stuff unlocks new stuff that will help you to progress on higher difficulties. Also, Vengeance mode is a simple arena, where you fight waves of monsters and bosses.

What can I say? Yes, I do like the game for its fast paced action, cool skill tree and variety. It will not suite everyone, more genre fan oriented, but anyways - you should give it a try. [b]And remember: this game punishes you. If you came to this page thinking: "I wonder, is it something like Diablo/Grim Dawn?", - I got some bad news for you. It's more oriented for short playsessions packed with action and ragequits.[/b] Cheers!

7 Green Dudes out of 10. Would consume enemies again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208078171', 'num_games_owned': 723, 'num_reviews': 553, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1530898079}
review:
It's okay. It's playable for sure. The randomly generated skill tree is a neat addition to the rogue like aspect. 

I don't think this game really took any chances on making something special. It all feels really standard. It feels safe. There's nothing I've seen in almost 4 hours that makes me go "damn." I haven't seen anything that I haven't really just figured out immediately on it's role or affect

All the weapons feel different and have different animations but sometimes I sware your guy turns around and hits the air or just misses when they're standing right in the radius of my swing? Really annoying and ends up getting you stun locked sometimes.

I guess I'd recommend this game at a discount. It's not bad by any means but don't expect to be blown away. This won't make anyone's top 5's, not even narrowing the category down to rogue-like only would get it into the top 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079352417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 2132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2132, 'last_played': 1529764714}
review:
ハクスラ＋ローグライクなアクションゲーム。
簡単に説明するならISAACを仏教的にした感じ？

ローグライクな部類のゲームだがステージ・MOB・スキル・装備も
そこまで多くはないのでプレイしてればすぐ覚えます。
選択キャラは初期キャラの他に
弓特化・魔法特化・脳筋バカの合計4人とこちらも少なめ。
序盤はそうでもなくても接近キャラが後々不利になります。
特に実績解除目的なら、弓＞魔法＝初期＞脳筋　でおｋです。
ただローグライクなゲームなのでドロップ運、スキル運の引きによっては
脳筋でも化けるのでそれはそれで楽しめるかと思います。

「パッド推奨」とゲーム内でも推奨するように
アクション要素が強めのゲームとなっているので
アクション好きな人でも楽しめます。
また覚えることも少ないので気軽にローグライクなアクションやってみたい人、
ローグライク初心者にもオススメできるゲームです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198090035210', 'num_games_owned': 2207, 'num_reviews': 256, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1580188865}
review:
一言でディアブローグライクと言いたいところだが、このゲームを簡潔に述べるにはかなり特殊なので難しい
ローグライク色が強いアクションゲームとなっている

信仰を抱き迷信を信じ予言に翻弄され生贄を捧げた帝国
生贄として捧げられた主人公は4名の呪術師により悪魔として復活を遂げ復讐を誓う

モードはストーリーとベンジェンスの2種類あるが一度ストーリーをクリアしないと選択できない（ベンジェンスは恐らく死ぬまで潜り続けるモードと思われる）
難易度は4種類あるがノーマルをクリアしないと上位難度を選択できない
キャラクターも4種類存在するが戦績を開放しないと他3種は使用できない

操作性はパッド推奨でキーボード、マウスでは慣れが必要になる
キーボード＆マウス操作は3タイプで以下の通り
①移動及び攻撃全ての操作をキーボードのみで完結するタイプ
②キーボードで移動、マウスで攻撃するタイプ
③マウスで移動、攻撃を行いその他の操作をキーボードで行うタイプ
マウスで移動、攻撃を行う操作はDiabloのようにLMBのみで移動と攻撃を賄うことができないため慣れが必要だ（LMBで移動、RMBで攻撃、またはその逆）
スペースで回避行動を行うが近接攻撃は回避できない
シフトでスプリント
Wキーで近接、遠距離切り替え
武器切り替え以外の全ての行動にスタミナゲージを消耗する

インベントリーは6スロットあるが消費アイテムやパッシブアイテムのストックのみで装備品は拾い物をその場で交換という流れ
アイテムにはレアリティがあり、消費アイテムにはヘルス回復と矢の補充など、中には所持していると能力が上がるパッシブアイテム（Diablo2でいうところのチャーム）もある

スキルツリーは毎プレイランダムに変化するため運便りだ
内容は開始時に伏せられており、ポイントを取得することで段階的に内容が解放される

レベルシステムも少々変わっており、敵討伐時に自動でEXP入手とはならない
敵を倒すと腐敗するまでのカウントダウンが始まり、腐敗する前に略奪するか吸収するかを選択する
略奪を選べばいくらかの金貨とアイテムがドロップし、吸収を選べばEXPを入手することができる

MAPは自動生成で、アイテム購入場、武具クラフト場、武具アップグレード場等が至る所に出現し全て金貨が必要となる

道中特殊なパッシブスキルを手に入れられればスタミナが消耗しなくなるなどの恩恵を受けられたりする

ボスを討伐することでいくらかの戦績が開放され、以降使用できるスキルや発見できるアイテム、装備等が増えていく

操作性はあまり良いとは言えないが不自由ない日本語も完備しており全体的にはオススメだ
難易度は高めなので注意

author: {'steamid': '76561198045318473', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1513896183}
review:
Un jeu aux mécaniques plutôt simples rappelant le légendaire binding of Isaac. vous voici débarqué dans la mythologie indienne avec votre personnage. Le jeu se divise sous forme de salles relié par des chemins, en vue isometrique inclinable. chaque salle est generée proécudralement et proposera ennemi, coffre, marchand, buff ou autres joyeusetés qui vont influer sur votre run actuelle.

le gameplay, simpliste, se montre tout de même compliqué, prevoyez donc de mourir plus d'une fois :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198097905877', 'num_games_owned': 709, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1670697147}
review:
Amazing hack and slash game, although a bit on the short side.

    -It has permadeath.
    -You unlock things for your next runs.
    -You have armor, a small inventory and carry 2 different weapons (melee + ranged/magical).
    -The maps are generated with random pieces (like Ziggurat or Rogue Legacy).
    -You can save your run and continue it later (they can last 1 hour so that's appreciated).
    -When you Level up you get to chose a passive/active ability, the variety is great.
    -Good replayability (you unlock bosses, weapons, abilities, characters and difficulties for your next runs).

BTW, you should use a controller to play. My XBox 360 controller works fine.

PS: I play on linux and it works fine. At least in my case I only found a problem with a wireless XBox 360 controller that wouldn't work correctly, the wired one was fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029800969', 'num_games_owned': 1403, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 1275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1112, 'last_played': 1693046754}
review:
Рогалик, основанный на индийской мифологии - что-то интересное.  Выбери своего Асуру и отомсти людям. Всего 5 крепостей которые нужно пройти ради совершения мести.

[h1]Плюсы:[/h1]
[list]
[*] 4 Асуры на выбор, которые открываются по мере прохождения. Асура лучник - самый балансный:D
[*] Рандомные крепости.
[*] Случайные навыки вашего демона в 4-х ветках прокачки.
[*] Много рандома, но даже самые дерьмые вещи и улучшения не решают. Всё зависит от вашего скила.
[*] Графически игра смотрится просто шикарно.
[*] Звуковое сопровождение выполнено в демоническом стиле.
[/list]

[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
[list]
[*] Вещей много, но толковых можно посчитатьпо пальцам рук.
[*] Некорректно работают некоторые предметы, вещи и оружия.
[*] Есть баги из-за которых игра зависает. Словил такой используя заклинание, персонаж встал как вкопанный и всё.
[/list]

[h1][i]ИТОГИ[/i][/h1]

В игре есть 2 различные концовки. Первая получается после прохождения на самом низком уровне сложности. Вторая - на всех остальных. Прохождение игры на всех уровнях сложности заняло часов 10. Если вы хотели лишь увидеть 2 концовки - это займёт часа 4. Ценовой сегмент будет зависеть от времени затраченного на игру. Если вы хотели пройти её на всех уровнях сложности и поиграть за разных асур и пофармить ачивки, то цена оправдана.  В другом случае получилась высоковата. Поиграть в данную игру стоит.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367837693', 'num_games_owned': 643, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1521642680}
review: 很多问题、最大问题是不能全屏。设置全屏后，最下方还是有电脑的任务栏出现。另外就是技能快捷无效，升级点出技能后，要发动只能用鼠标去点击，这是战斗中啊，敌方速度很快，你找位置点击的功夫可以重生了。这说明什么？说明技能栏里面的主动技能无效！
developer_response:
Hi,

Apologies for the issue. The game does support full screen. However, please send us the log file so that we can look into the issue. It can be found under the following path:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 [Windows]
]SteamInstallFolder\steamapps\common\Asura\log.txt
SteamInstallFolder\steamapps\common\Asura\Asura_Data\output_log.txt

Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198268411615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 938, 'last_played': 1679149830}
review:
很棒的一款游戏，操作手感很好，打击感也非常舒服，当然最有特色的地方在于游戏的随机性，丰富的武器系统和天赋技能系统让这个游戏玩起来丝毫不会觉得乏味。
游戏本身难度偏高，对走位要求、技能组合和装备选择要求非常细致，但是如果你是一个愈挫愈勇、喜欢操作和冒险的玩家，那入手这个游戏绝对是值得的！
至于说缺点嘛，好像刚开始只能选择一个角色，角色的解锁挺难。然后要是能出个多人合作的模式就完美了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198134156523', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1163, 'last_played': 1526192764}
review:
这游戏简直是手残党的噩梦...玩了四天普！通！模！式！都！没！过！差点把手柄摔了，好气，非常气:steamsad:
游戏是个好游戏，技能、装备的随机性很强，玩起来来很有意思，里面偶尔会有一些考验人品的时候，[strike]然而我脸就没白过2333[/strike]
就算是这样，还是要给这款游戏一个好评：9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198252341008', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1575040409}
review:
买了这款游戏已经三个月了，但是说实话还没怎么玩哈哈哈哈。
游戏的风格和以撒大相径庭。不过有很多我个人觉得很有意思的设计。包括天赋树和附魔道具之类的，还有该死的装备掉落。个人最高冲到了第五层。这个游戏对于走位的要求很高，所以对于经常手残的我来说非常的不友好。
但是这个游戏是值这个价的，无论是音乐还是画面优化，可以看出阿三的用心。喜欢以撒这类游戏的朋友可以尽管买买买。
以上。
